26/**
27 * DOC: atomic plane helpers
28 *
29 * The functions here are used by the atomic plane helper functions to
30 * implement legacy plane updates (i.e., drm_plane->update_plane() and
31 * drm_plane->disable_plane()). This allows plane updates to use the
32 * atomic state infrastructure and perform plane updates as separate
33 * prepare/check/commit/cleanup steps.
34 */
35
36#include <sys/cdefs.h>
37__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: intel_atomic_plane.c,v 1.3 2018/08/27 07:19:44 riastradh Exp $");
38
39#include <drm/drmP.h>
40#include <drm/drm_atomic_helper.h>
41#include <drm/drm_plane_helper.h>
42#include "intel_drv.h"
43
44/**
45 * intel_create_plane_state - create plane state object
46 * @plane: drm plane
47 *
48 * Allocates a fresh plane state for the given plane and sets some of
49 * the state values to sensible initial values.
50 *
51 * Returns: A newly allocated plane state, or NULL on failure
52 */
53struct intel_plane_state *
54intel_create_plane_state(struct drm_plane *plane)
55{
56 struct intel_plane_state *state;
57
58 state = kzalloc(sizeof(*state), GFP_KERNEL);
59 if (!state)
60 return NULL;
61
62 state->base.plane = plane;
63 state->base.rotation = BIT(DRM_ROTATE_0);
64 state->ckey.flags = I915_SET_COLORKEY_NONE;
65
66 return state;
67}
68
69/**
70 * intel_plane_duplicate_state - duplicate plane state
71 * @plane: drm plane
72 *
73 * Allocates and returns a copy of the plane state (both common and
74 * Intel-specific) for the specified plane.
75 *
76 * Returns: The newly allocated plane state, or NULL on failure.
77 */
78struct drm_plane_state *
79intel_plane_duplicate_state(struct drm_plane *plane)
80{
81 struct drm_plane_state *state;
82 struct intel_plane_state *intel_state;
83
84 intel_state = kmemdup(plane->state, sizeof(*intel_state), GFP_KERNEL);
85
86 if (!intel_state)
87 return NULL;
88
89 state = &intel_state->base;
90
91 __drm_atomic_helper_plane_duplicate_state(plane, state);
92
93 return state;
94}
95
96/**
97 * intel_plane_destroy_state - destroy plane state
98 * @plane: drm plane
99 * @state: state object to destroy
100 *
101 * Destroys the plane state (both common and Intel-specific) for the
102 * specified plane.
103 */
104void
105intel_plane_destroy_state(struct drm_plane *plane,
106 struct drm_plane_state *state)
107{
108 drm_atomic_helper_plane_destroy_state(plane, state);
109}
110
111static int intel_plane_atomic_check(struct drm_plane *plane,
112 struct drm_plane_state *state)
113{
114 struct drm_crtc *crtc = state->crtc;
115 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc __unused;
116 struct intel_crtc_state *crtc_state;
117 struct intel_plane *intel_plane = to_intel_plane(plane);
118 struct intel_plane_state *intel_state = to_intel_plane_state(state);
119 struct drm_crtc_state *drm_crtc_state;
120 int ret;
121
122 crtc = crtc ? crtc : plane->state->crtc;
123 intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
124
125 /*
126 * Both crtc and plane->crtc could be NULL if we're updating a
127 * property while the plane is disabled. We don't actually have
128 * anything driver-specific we need to test in that case, so
129 * just return success.
130 */
131 if (!crtc)
132 return 0;
133
134 drm_crtc_state = drm_atomic_get_existing_crtc_state(state->state, crtc);
135 if (WARN_ON(!drm_crtc_state))
136 return -EINVAL;
137
138 crtc_state = to_intel_crtc_state(drm_crtc_state);
139
140 /*
141 * The original src/dest coordinates are stored in state->base, but
142 * we want to keep another copy internal to our driver that we can
143 * clip/modify ourselves.
144 */
145 intel_state->src.x1 = state->src_x;
146 intel_state->src.y1 = state->src_y;
147 intel_state->src.x2 = state->src_x + state->src_w;
148 intel_state->src.y2 = state->src_y + state->src_h;
149 intel_state->dst.x1 = state->crtc_x;
150 intel_state->dst.y1 = state->crtc_y;
151 intel_state->dst.x2 = state->crtc_x + state->crtc_w;
152 intel_state->dst.y2 = state->crtc_y + state->crtc_h;
153
154 /* Clip all planes to CRTC size, or 0x0 if CRTC is disabled */
155 intel_state->clip.x1 = 0;
156 intel_state->clip.y1 = 0;
157 intel_state->clip.x2 =
158 crtc_state->base.active ? crtc_state->pipe_src_w : 0;
159 intel_state->clip.y2 =
160 crtc_state->base.active ? crtc_state->pipe_src_h : 0;
161
162 if (state->fb && intel_rotation_90_or_270(state->rotation)) {
163 if (!(state->fb->modifier[0] == I915_FORMAT_MOD_Y_TILED ||
164 state->fb->modifier[0] == I915_FORMAT_MOD_Yf_TILED)) {
165 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Y/Yf tiling required for 90/270!\n");
166 return -EINVAL;
167 }
168
169 /*
170 * 90/270 is not allowed with RGB64 16:16:16:16,
171 * RGB 16-bit 5:6:5, and Indexed 8-bit.
172 * TBD: Add RGB64 case once its added in supported format list.
173 */
174 switch (state->fb->pixel_format) {
175 case DRM_FORMAT_C8:
176 case DRM_FORMAT_RGB565:
177 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Unsupported pixel format %s for 90/270!\n",
178 drm_get_format_name(state->fb->pixel_format));
179 return -EINVAL;
180
181 default:
182 break;
183 }
184 }
185
186 intel_state->visible = false;
187 ret = intel_plane->check_plane(plane, crtc_state, intel_state);
188 if (ret)
189 return ret;
190
191 return intel_plane_atomic_calc_changes(&crtc_state->base, state);
192}
193
194static void intel_plane_atomic_update(struct drm_plane *plane,
195 struct drm_plane_state *old_state)
196{
197 struct intel_plane *intel_plane = to_intel_plane(plane);
198 struct intel_plane_state *intel_state =
199 to_intel_plane_state(plane->state);
200
201 intel_plane->commit_plane(plane, intel_state);
202}
203
204const struct drm_plane_helper_funcs intel_plane_helper_funcs = {
205 .prepare_fb = intel_prepare_plane_fb,
206 .cleanup_fb = intel_cleanup_plane_fb,
207 .atomic_check = intel_plane_atomic_check,
208 .atomic_update = intel_plane_atomic_update,
209};
210
211/**
212 * intel_plane_atomic_get_property - fetch plane property value
213 * @plane: plane to fetch property for
214 * @state: state containing the property value
215 * @property: property to look up
216 * @val: pointer to write property value into
217 *
218 * The DRM core does not store shadow copies of properties for
219 * atomic-capable drivers. This entrypoint is used to fetch
220 * the current value of a driver-specific plane property.
221 */
222int
223intel_plane_atomic_get_property(struct drm_plane *plane,
224 const struct drm_plane_state *state,
225 struct drm_property *property,
226 uint64_t *val)
227{
228 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Unknown plane property '%s'\n", property->name);
229 return -EINVAL;
230}
231
232/**
233 * intel_plane_atomic_set_property - set plane property value
234 * @plane: plane to set property for
235 * @state: state to update property value in
236 * @property: property to set
237 * @val: value to set property to
238 *
239 * Writes the specified property value for a plane into the provided atomic
240 * state object.
241 *
242 * Returns 0 on success, -EINVAL on unrecognized properties
243 */
244int
245intel_plane_atomic_set_property(struct drm_plane *plane,
246 struct drm_plane_state *state,
247 struct drm_property *property,
248 uint64_t val)
249{
250 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Unknown plane property '%s'\n", property->name);
251 return -EINVAL;
252}
